title: Melbourne University wants to double PhD researchers in Germany to 200
text:
Melbourne University is aiming to double the number of PhD researchers it has in Germany over the next 18 months as it eyes the Continent's €95 billion ($154 billion) Horizon Europe higher-education fund.

By mid 2021 the university wants 200 PhD students at universities in Bonn and Berlin, that compares to just 20 in 2014 and 100 this year. The new target represents 15 per cent of all Phd students enrolled at the university.

Deputy vice chancellor, research, Jim McCluskey said the German higher-education system is very strong, underpinned by government spending on R &D of 3 per cent of GDP, compared to 1.9 per cent in Australia.

He said about 45 per cent of Melbourne University's research is in medicine, so the German PhDs will focus on public health, immunology, bio and clinical medicine as well as engineering, physical sciences and humanities.

"Germany is without question the heart of Europe. Europe is much bigger than it used to be. It has ties with the middle east and Africa. We see Germany as the front door to Europe," professor McCluskey said.

"Germans are enchanted by Australia, they speak fabulous English and at the level of post graduate science English is the language of business.
description: One of Australia's highest ranked universities is rapidly expanding its research connections in Europe.
